extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb beets (4 to 6; preferably Chioggia*), 1 inch of stems left intact
extendedIngredients.originalName: beets (4 to 6; preferably Chioggia*), 1 inch of stems left intact

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh lemon juice, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: orange zest
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon finely grated fresh orange zest (from 2 oranges)
extendedIngredients.originalName: finely grated fresh orange zest (from 2 oranges)

title: Chioggia Beets with Raspberry Mint Vinaigrette
summary: Chioggia Beets with Raspberry Mint Vinaigrette might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 176 calories, 2g of protein, and 14g of fat each. For $1.07 per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up orange zest, olive oil, mint, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 40 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 48%. This score is good. Try Roasted Chioggia Beets with Feta, Roasted Chioggia Beets With Nectarine Juices & Marjoram, and Beets With Creamy Balsamic Vinaigrette and Mint for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Cover beets with water by 1 inch in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan and simmer until tender when pierced in center with a fork, about 30 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Let stand until cool enough to handle, then slip off and discard skins. Cut beets into 1/4-inch-thick slices.                                                                While beets are cooking, stir together scallions, 2 tablespoons vinegar, lemon juice to taste, mint, zest, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined. Add warm beets and toss with vinaigrette and vinegar and salt to taste. Serve warm or slightly chilled.                                                                *Sometimes called candy-cane beets, chioggias become more aggressive in flavor as they age, so search out relatively young beets, with a diameter of 1 1/2 to 2 inches.

steps.step: Cover beets with water by 1 inch in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan and simmer until tender when pierced in center with a fork, about 30 minutes.
Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water.
Let stand until cool enough to handle, then slip off and discard skins.
While beets are cooking, stir together scallions, 2 tablespoons vinegar, lemon juice to taste, mint, zest, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined.
Add warm beets and toss with vinaigrette and vinegar and salt to taste.
*Sometimes called candy-cane beets, chioggias become more aggressive in flavor as they age, so search out relatively young beets, with a diameter of 1 1/2 to 2 inches.
